channel.title: BM Lobby Redesign
channel.description:
Alright, I made a minor change to the desk in the BM lobby. It's probably way too late to make this change, but I wanted to know what you guys thought. [img]https://forums.blackmesasource.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=465&stc=1&d=1263596206[/img] High-res version: [url]https://img685.imageshack.us/img685/1377/bmlobby.png[/url]
In case it's hard to tell what I did, here's an outlined version: [url]https://img685.imageshack.us/img685/3244/bmlobbyoutline.png[/url]
[COLOR='DeepSkyBlue'][Explanation] Ok to me it just seemed like the lobby desk that BM is using was too plain and low to the ground. It didn't really stand out to me as a focal point and felt uneven with the hangy-screen-thingie above it :3 ![bm_lobby.jpg|448x280](upload://3QLA8QanwyGojBTdzONnvXBqShu.jpeg) ![bm_lobby_outline.jpg|448x280](upload://w9UbFniB0Vd0uepx4Tw0aUCaTcU.jpeg)

item.title: BM Lobby Redesign

item.description:
I vote for the devs not looking back to change things they have already finished, but rather finishing what has yet to be completed in order for Black Mesa to be playable and ready for release.

item.title: BM Lobby Redesign
item.dc:creator: Conti
item.description:
Yes, it is the standard procedure… But looking at the image of the lobby, we can deduce that the procedure didn’t work very well and people perished there (inasmuch as the room is full of zombies, including a zombie guard that probably is the one that says “Hey Mr. Freeman, I had a system crash…” – and if he is there, is secure to say that he fought and died near the desk).

So, my suggestion is still valid. Anyway, it is up to devs implement this. I only said that cause I think this minor detail would add much more caos and terror feeling to the scene.

Read full topic

item.title: BM Lobby Redesign
item.dc:creator: UrBY
item.description:
About the desk being organised after the disaster. I don’t know about you but when the fire alarm goes off at work I don’t go to town on my desk and trash the office.

The scientists wouldn’t have the guts to fight back (what would essentially just be headcrabs at the start) and the security team probably wouldn’t have time to react. Chances are when the alarm sounded that everyone prepared to leave their station and head for a designated emergency area. Standard procedure.

Read full topic
